member.name: M:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Api.BrightcoveApi.FindVideoById(System.Int64,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Finds a single video with the specified id.
member.param: The id of the video you would like to retrieve.

A list of the fields you wish to have populated in the videos contained in the returned object. If you omit this parameter, the method returns the following fields of the Videos: id, name, shortDescription, longDescription, creationDate, publisheddate, lastModifiedDate, linkURL, linkText, tags, videoStillURL, thumbnailURL, referenceId, length, economics, playsTotal, playsTrailingWeek. If you use a token with URL access, this method also returns FLVURL, renditions, FLVFullLength, videoFullLength.

A list of the custom fields you wish to have populated in the videos contained in the returned object. If you omit this parameter, no custom fields are returned, unless you include the value 'customFields' in the video_fields parameter.
member.returns: The Video you requested, with the specified fields populated, or null, if there is no video with that id.

The fuzzy search is available only if your account is based in the United States.

member.name: M:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Api.BrightcoveApi.CreateVideo(BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveVideo,BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Api.Connectors.FileUploadInfo,BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.EncodeTo,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new video by uploading a file.
member.param: The metadata for the video you want to create.
Information for the file to be uploaded.

If the file requires transcoding, use this parameter to specify the target encoding. Valid values are MP4 or FLV, representing the H264 and VP6 codecs respectively. Note that transcoding of FLV files to another codec is not currently supported. This parameter is optional and defaults to FLV.

If the file is a supported transcodeable type, this optional flag can be used to control the number of transcoded renditions. If true (default), multiple renditions at varying encoding rates and dimensions are created. Setting this to false will cause a single transcoded VP6 rendition to be created at the standard encoding rate and dimensions.
If the video file is H.264 encoded and if createMultipleRenditions is true, then multiple VP6 renditions are created and in addition the H.264 source is retained as an additional rendition.
Use this option to prevent H.264 source files from being transcoded. This parameter cannot be used in combination with create_multiple_renditions. It is optional and defaults to false.
member.returns: The numeric ID of the newly created video.

member.name: M:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Api.BrightcoveApi.DeleteVideo(System.Int64,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes a video, specified by video ID
member.param: The ID of the video you'd like to delete
If true, video will be deleted even if it is part of a manual playlist or assigned to a player. The video will be removed from all playlists and players in which it appears, then deleted.

Set this to true if you want also to delete shared copies of this video. Note that this will delete all shared copies from your account, as well as from all accounts with which the video has been shared, regardless of whether or not those accounts are currently using the video in playlists or players.

member.param: The reference ID of the video you'd like to delete

Set this to true if you want also to delete shared copies of this video. member.name: M:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Api.BrightcoveApi.ShareVideo(System.Int64,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int64})
member.summary: Shares the specified video with a list of sharee accounts.
member.param: The id for video that will be shared.

If the target account has the option enabled, setting this flag to true will bypass the approval process, causing the shared video to automatically appear in the target account's library. If the target account does not have the option enabled, or this flag is unspecified or false, then the shared video will be queued up to be approved by the target account before appearing in their library.
If true, indicates that if the shared video already exists in the target account's library, it should be overwritten by the video in the sharer's account.
List of Account IDs to share video with.
member.returns: List of new video IDs (one for each account ID).

member.name: T:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.PlaylistType
member.summary:
Playlist types.
Explicit: A manual playlist, the videos of which were added individually. OldestToNewest: A smart playlist, ordered from oldest to newest, by published date. NewestToOldest: A smart playlist, ordered from newest to oldest, by published date. Alphabetical: A smart playlist, ordered alphabetically. PlaysTotal: A smart playlist, ordered by total plays. PlaysTrailingWeek: A smart playlist, ordered by most plays in the past week. StartDateOldestToNewest: A smart playlist, ordered from oldest to newest, by start date. StartDateNewestToOldest: A smart playlist, ordered from newest to oldest, by start date.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveVideo.Renditions
member.summary: An collection of Renditions that represent the multi-bitrate streaming renditions available for this Video. A Video should have not more than 10 Renditions. Note that when creating or updating a video, only one of either VideoFullLength and Renditions may be set. If both are set, only Renditions will be submitted to the API and VideoFullLength will be ignored. Note that this property can be accessed with the Media API only with a special read or write token.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveCuePoint.VideoId
member.summary: Although the API docs say that this field is "A list of the ids of one or more videos that this cue point applies to", it appears that in practice this is actually only a single video ID, and not a comma-separated list.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveCuePoint.Time

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveCuePoint.ForceStop
member.summary: If true, the video stops playback at the cue point. This setting is valid only for AD type cue points.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveCuePoint.MetaData
member.summary: A string that can be passed along with a CODE cue point. Not more than 512 characters.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveCuePoint.Type
member.summary: Required. An integer code corresponding to the type of cue point. One of AD or CODE. An Ad cue point is used to trigger mid-roll ad requests. A Code cue point can be used to indicate a chapter or scene break in the video.

member.name: T:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Containers.BrightcoveItemCollection`1
member.summary: Represents a collection of BrightcoveItems

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Containers.BrightcoveItemCollection`1.PageNumber
member.summary: The current page of results. (Each page is limited to a max of 100 items)

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Containers.BrightcoveItemCollection`1.PageSize
member.summary: The size of each page of results. If not specified, the default is 100

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Containers.BrightcoveItemCollection`1.TotalCount
member.summary: The total number of items available

member.name: T:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveRendition
member.summary: The BrightcoveRendition object represents one of the multi-bitrate streaming renditions of a video. A Video should have not more than 10 Rendition objects.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveRendition.ControllerType
member.summary: [Optional — required for live streaming only] Depending on your CDN, one of the following values: LIMELIGHT_LIVE or AKAMAI_LIVE.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveRendition.EncodingRate
member.summary: The rendition's encoding rate, in bits per second.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveRendition.FrameHeight
member.summary: The rendition's display height, in pixels.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveRendition.FrameWidth
member.summary: The rendition's display width, in pixels.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveRendition.Size
member.summary: The file size of the rendition, in bytes.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveRendition.RemoteUrl
member.summary: Required, for remote assets. The complete path to the file hosted on the remote server. If the file is served using progressive download, then you must include the file name and extension for the file. You can also use a URL that re-directs to a URL that includes the file name and extension. If the file is served using Flash streaming, use the remoteStreamName attribute to provide the stream name.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveRendition.RemoteStreamName
member.summary: [Optional — required for streaming remote assets only] A stream name for Flash streaming appended to the value of the remoteUrl property.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveRendition.Url
member.summary: The URL of the rendition file.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveRendition.VideoDuration
member.summary: The length of the remote video asset in milliseconds.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveRendition.VideoCodec
member.summary: Valid values are SORENSON, ON2, and H264.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveRendition.VideoContainer
member.summary: (I can't actually find this property defined in any documentation, but it's returned by the API and seems useful) The container in which the video resides. Will generally be either "MP4" or "VP6" (flash).

member.name: T:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveImage
member.summary: The BrightcoveImage object represents an image file in Brightcove's system. Images are associated with videos as thumbnail images, video still images, or logo overlays. An image can be a JPEG, GIF, or PNG-formatted image. Note that when creating a new image asset, the only property that is required is type. If you are not uploading a file, the remoteUrl property is also required.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveImage.Id
member.summary: A number that uniquely identifies the Image. This id is automatically assigned by Brightcove when the Image is created.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveImage.ReferenceId
member.summary: A user-specified id that uniquely identifies this Image.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveImage.Type
member.summary: THUMBNAIL, VIDEO_STILL, or LOGO_OVERLAY. The type is writable and required when you create an Image; it cannot subsequently be changed.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveImage.RemoteUrl
member.summary: The URL of a remote image file. This property is required if you are not uploading a file for the image asset.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcoveImage.DisplayName
member.summary: The name of the asset, which will be displayed in the Media module.

member.name: T:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcovePlaylist
member.summary: The BrightcovePlaylist object is a collection of BrightcoveVideos.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcovePlaylist.AccountId
member.summary: A number that uniquely identifies the account to which this Playlist belongs, assigned by Brightcove.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcovePlaylist.FilterTags
member.summary: A list of the tags that apply to this smart playlist.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcovePlaylist.Id
member.summary: A number that uniquely identifies the Playlist. This id is automatically assigned when the Playlist is created.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcovePlaylist.Name
member.summary: The title of this Playlist, limited to 100 characters. The name is a required property when you create a playlist.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcovePlaylist.PlaylistType
member.summary:
For a manual playlist, set this to EXPLICIT. For a smart playlist, indicate how to order the playlist by setting this to one of the following choices: OLDEST_TO_NEWEST (by activated date) NEWEST_TO_OLDEST (by activated date) START_DATE_OLDEST_TO_NEWEST START_DATE_NEWEST_TO_OLDEST ALPHABETICAL (by video name) PLAYSTOTAL PLAYS_TRAILING_WEEK
The playlistType is a required property when you create a playlist.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcovePlaylist.ReferenceId
member.summary: A user-specified id, limited to 150 characters, that uniquely identifies this Playlist. Note that the find_playlists_by_reference_ids method cannot handle referenceIds that contain commas, so you may want to avoid using commas in referenceId values.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcovePlaylist.ShortDescription
member.summary: A short description describing the Playlist, limited to 250 characters.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcovePlaylist.TagInclusionRule
member.summary: For a smart playlist, defines whether the video must contain all or contain one or more of the values in filterTags. Use AND for "contains all" and OR for "contains one or more." Not available in Read API methods.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcovePlaylist.ThumbnailUrl
member.summary: The URL of the thumbnail associated with this Playlist.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcovePlaylist.VideoIds
member.summary: A list of the ids of the Videos that are encapsulated in the Playlist.

member.name: P:BrightcoveMapiWrapper.Model.Items.BrightcovePlaylist.Videos
member.summary: A list of the BrightcoveVideo objects that are encapsulated in the Playlist.
